source: FDA Cardiovascular Device Guidance + ACC/AHA Clinical Trial Standards + SCAI Guidelines

primary_efficacy.name: Target Lesion Revascularization (TLR)
primary_efficacy.definition: Any repeat percutaneous or surgical revascularization of the target lesion due to restenosis or other complication
primary_efficacy.success_criteria: TLR rate <10% at 12 months (for coronary stents)
primary_efficacy.clinical_significance: Clinically-driven TLR indicates inadequate initial treatment or restenosis
primary_efficacy.typical_analysis: Kaplan-Meier time-to-event analysis with log-rank test
primary_efficacy.regulatory_notes: FDA accepts TLR as co-primary endpoint with MACE for coronary stents

primary_efficacy.name: Target Vessel Revascularization (TVR)
primary_efficacy.definition: Any repeat revascularization of the target vessel (not just target lesion)
primary_efficacy.clinical_significance: Broader measure than TLR; includes progression of disease in treated vessel
primary_efficacy.regulatory_notes: Less specific than TLR; may be influenced by non-device factors

primary_efficacy.name: Major Adverse Cardiac Events (MACE)
primary_efficacy.definition: Composite of death, myocardial infarction (MI), and target lesion revascularization
primary_efficacy.measurement_timepoint: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, annually to 5 years
primary_efficacy.success_criteria: MACE rate <15% at 12 months for coronary stents (non-inferiority to predicate)
primary_efficacy.source: ARC definitions; FDA PCI device guidance
primary_efficacy.clinical_significance: Gold standard composite endpoint for coronary interventions
primary_efficacy.typical_analysis: Time-to-first-event with Kaplan-Meier and Cox proportional hazards
primary_efficacy.regulatory_notes: FDA requires MACE as primary endpoint for most coronary devices; 12-month non-inferiority margin typically 3-5%

primary_efficacy.name: Acute Lumen Gain
primary_efficacy.definition: Increase in minimum lumen diameter (MLD) immediately post-procedure compared to baseline
primary_efficacy.success_criteria: Acute lumen gain ≥1.0 mm for atherectomy devices
primary_efficacy.clinical_significance: Immediate mechanical efficacy of debulking or dilation device
primary_efficacy.typical_analysis: Mean ± SD, paired t-test vs. baseline
primary_efficacy.regulatory_notes: Acute gain alone insufficient for approval; must demonstrate durability

primary_efficacy.name: Late Lumen Loss (LLL)
primary_efficacy.definition: Decrease in minimum lumen diameter from post-procedure to follow-up angiography
primary_efficacy.success_criteria: In-stent LLL <0.5 mm for drug-eluting stents
primary_efficacy.source: QCA core lab standards; ARC definitions
primary_efficacy.clinical_significance: Surrogate for restenosis; lower LLL correlates with lower TLR rates
primary_efficacy.typical_analysis: Mean ± SD with 95% CI; non-inferiority testing to predicate
primary_efficacy.regulatory_notes: FDA accepts LLL as surrogate endpoint if correlation with TLR demonstrated; margin typically 0.2-0.3 mm

primary_efficacy.name: Binary Restenosis
primary_efficacy.definition: ≥50% diameter stenosis at target lesion on follow-up angiography
primary_efficacy.success_criteria: In-stent binary restenosis <10% for drug-eluting stents
primary_efficacy.clinical_significance: Dichotomous outcome for restenosis; clinically relevant threshold
primary_efficacy.typical_analysis: Proportion with 95% exact CI; chi-square test vs. control

primary_efficacy.name: TIMI Flow Grade
primary_efficacy.definition: Angiographic assessment of coronary blood flow (0=no flow, 1=minimal, 2=partial, 3=normal)
primary_efficacy.success_criteria: TIMI 3 flow achieved in ≥95% of cases post-procedure
primary_efficacy.clinical_significance: Normal TIMI 3 flow associated with better outcomes post-MI
primary_efficacy.typical_analysis: Proportion achieving TIMI 3, ordinal logistic regression
primary_efficacy.regulatory_notes: Core lab adjudication recommended for consistency

primary_efficacy.name: Procedural Success
primary_efficacy.definition: Successful device deployment with <30% residual stenosis and TIMI 3 flow, without in-hospital MACE
primary_efficacy.clinical_significance: Composite measure of acute device performance and early safety
primary_efficacy.typical_analysis: Proportion with exact 95% CI; superiority or non-inferiority test
primary_efficacy.regulatory_notes: Definition must be pre-specified; typically assessed by independent core lab

primary_safety.name: Cardiac Death
primary_safety.definition: Death due to cardiac cause (MI, heart failure, arrhythmia) or unknown cause
primary_safety.clinical_significance: Most severe adverse outcome; requires adjudication
primary_safety.typical_analysis: Kaplan-Meier cumulative incidence with competing risk for non-cardiac death

primary_safety.name: Myocardial Infarction (MI)
primary_safety.definition: Periprocedural MI: CK-MB >3× ULN or troponin >5× ULN + symptoms/ECG changes. Spontaneous MI: Universal Definition
primary_safety.success_criteria: Periprocedural MI <5%, spontaneous MI <3% at 12 months
primary_safety.source: Fourth Universal Definition of MI (ARC-4a for periprocedural)
primary_safety.clinical_significance: Surrogate for device thrombosis or embolization; requires biomarker elevation
primary_safety.typical_analysis: Proportion with 95% CI; time-to-event for spontaneous MI
primary_safety.regulatory_notes: Must distinguish periprocedural from spontaneous; CEC adjudication required

primary_safety.name: Stroke
primary_safety.definition: New neurological deficit lasting >24 hours with imaging confirmation (ischemic or hemorrhagic)
primary_safety.success_criteria: Stroke <2% at 30 days for structural heart interventions
primary_safety.clinical_significance: Devastating complication; requires neurologist assessment and imaging
primary_safety.typical_analysis: Kaplan-Meier cumulative incidence with competing risk for death
primary_safety.regulatory_notes: Distinguish disabling vs. non-disabling stroke; independent neurologist evaluation recommended

primary_safety.name: Stent Thrombosis
primary_safety.definition: ARC definite/probable thrombosis: acute coronary syndrome + angiographic/pathologic confirmation of thrombus
primary_safety.measurement_timepoint: Acute (0-24 hrs), subacute (1-30 days), late (31-365 days), very late (>365 days)
primary_safety.clinical_significance: Catastrophic complication often presenting as MI or death
primary_safety.typical_analysis: Kaplan-Meier time-to-event with landmark analysis (early vs. late)
primary_safety.regulatory_notes: FDA focuses on definite/probable ST; CEC adjudication required; dual antiplatelet therapy duration affects late/very late ST

primary_safety.name: Major Bleeding
primary_safety.definition: BARC Type 3-5: Overt bleeding with Hb drop ≥3 g/dL, transfusion, cardiac tamponade, ICH, or fatal bleeding
primary_safety.clinical_significance: Balance efficacy (antithrombotic therapy) with bleeding risk
primary_safety.typical_analysis: Cumulative incidence with competing risk for death
primary_safety.regulatory_notes: Must report access site and non-access site bleeding separately

primary_safety.name: Vascular Complications
primary_safety.definition: Access site hematoma requiring intervention, pseudoaneurysm, AV fistula, dissection, distal embolization
primary_safety.clinical_significance: Device size/profile and operator technique influence risk
primary_safety.typical_analysis: Proportion with 95% CI; subgroup analysis by access site (femoral vs. radial)
primary_safety.regulatory_notes: Ultrasound assessment recommended for large-bore devices

secondary_endpoints.name: Quality of Life (Angina Frequency)
secondary_endpoints.definition: Change in Seattle Angina Questionnaire (SAQ) angina frequency score from baseline
secondary_endpoints.clinical_significance: Patient-reported outcome measure for symptomatic benefit
secondary_endpoints.typical_analysis: Mixed effects model for change from baseline; responder analysis (≥10 point improvement)
secondary_endpoints.regulatory_notes: FDA accepts SAQ for symptomatic endpoints; pre-specified in protocol

secondary_endpoints.name: Exercise Tolerance (6-Minute Walk Test)
secondary_endpoints.definition: Distance walked in 6 minutes on flat surface
secondary_endpoints.clinical_significance: Objective functional capacity measure; correlates with NYHA class
secondary_endpoints.typical_analysis: Paired t-test or Wilcoxon for change from baseline
secondary_endpoints.regulatory_notes: Useful for heart failure and PAD devices; training effect must be controlled

secondary_endpoints.name: Patency (Primary, Assisted Primary, Secondary)
secondary_endpoints.definition: Vessel remains open without occlusion. Primary=no reintervention, Assisted Primary=intervention before occlusion, Secondary=after occlusion
secondary_endpoints.success_criteria: Primary patency >70% at 12 months for peripheral stents
secondary_endpoints.clinical_significance: Gold standard for peripheral vascular device durability
secondary_endpoints.typical_analysis: Kaplan-Meier survival analysis; competing risk of death or amputation
secondary_endpoints.regulatory_notes: Core lab duplex adjudication required; peak systolic velocity ratio >2.4 defines occlusion

secondary_endpoints.name: Hemodynamic Improvement (ABI, Toe Pressure)
secondary_endpoints.definition: Ankle-brachial index (ABI) increase ≥0.10 or toe pressure increase ≥10 mmHg
secondary_endpoints.clinical_significance: Objective hemodynamic measure of revascularization success
secondary_endpoints.typical_analysis: Proportion achieving threshold improvement; change from baseline analysis
secondary_endpoints.regulatory_notes: Supplement to clinical endpoints (walking distance, ulcer healing)

notes.core_lab_requirements: FDA typically requires independent core labs for angiographic (QCA, IVUS, OCT), ECG, and echocardiographic assessments
notes.clinical_events_committee: CEC adjudication required for MACE components (death, MI, stroke, revascularization) using pre-specified definitions
notes.non_inferiority_margins: For MACE: 3-5% absolute margin or 1.3-1.5 relative risk margin. For LLL: 0.2-0.3 mm margin
notes.follow_up_duration: Minimum 12 months for most devices; 5 years for new chemical entities (drug-eluting stents/balloons); lifetime for permanent implants (valves)
notes.imaging_modalities: QCA for lumen diameter, IVUS/OCT for vessel wall assessment, angiography for flow (TIMI grade)
notes.statistical_considerations: Sample size calculations must account for primary endpoint event rates, non-inferiority margins, Type I/II error rates, and anticipated loss to follow-up (typically 10-15%)
